mean_cn: n. 冗长演说；  v. 拖延议事
mean_en: an effort to prevent action in a legislature (such as the U.S. Senate or House of Representatives) by making a long speech or series of speeches
word_etyma: fili线+buster阻挡→用线档住→阻碍 → 故意阻碍
short_phrase: filibuster by making a very long speech
sentence: He filibustered the legislation by making a long speech until time ran out.
sentence_trans: 他通过滔滔不绝的演讲来拖延议事。
